revised_title: Investigating Reversal of Metallic Lines in Overexposed Photographs of Spectra
tldr: The author examines the phenomenon of metallic lines appearing reversed in overexposed photographs of spectra and explores the effects of exposure time, intensity of the spark, and other conditions on the reversal process. The study highlights the importance of using comparative exposures and understanding the sensitiveness of the spectrum reaction for accurate analysis of spectral data.
